greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Iterates of A276086 starting from 0.
comment: The unique infinite sequence such that a(0) = 0, a(n) = A276085(a(n+1)) for n >= 0, and A129251(a(n)) = 0 for n >= 1, i.e., all nonzero terms must be in A048103.
a(10) is 240 decimal digits long (can be found in b-file), and a(11) is too big to fit even into a b-file as it is 32700 decimal digits long, but it can be found in the given a-file.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10
Antti Karttunen, Terms a(0) .. a(11), without running index
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
xref: Cf. A153013, and also A179016, A219666, A259934 for more or less analogous sequences.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 14 2019
